welcome_message_body: Welcome to Luton, a charming town known for its rich history, beautiful parks, and vibrant cultural scene. We hope you have a wonderful time exploring all that Luton has to offer!

restaurants.name: La Dolce Vita
restaurants.description: La Dolce Vita is a italian restaurant located in Luton.

restaurants.name: Papa J's
restaurants.description: Papa J's is a indian restaurant located in Luton.

restaurants.name: Red Chilli Flavours of India
restaurants.description: Red Chilli Flavours of India is a indian restaurant located in Luton.

restaurants.name: Nando's
restaurants.description: Nando's is a portuguese restaurant located in Luton.
restaurants.address: Unit A The Galaxy Centre, Bridge St, Luton, LU1 2NB

restaurants.name: Aone Dosa
restaurants.description: Aone Dosa is a indian restaurant located in Luton.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Luton Airport is the largest and busiest terminal, serving both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: Terminal 2 at Luton Airport is a smaller terminal used primarily for low-cost carriers and charter flights.

wifi.note: Passengers can access free Wi-Fi throughout the airport by connecting to the 'LLA Free Wi-Fi' network.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at London Elstree Aerodrome Airport, serving domestic and international flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Northolt Airport serves both domestic and international flights.

wifi.note: WiFi is available throughout the airport for passengers to use.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The oldest and smallest terminal at Heathrow Airport, primarily used for domestic and European flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: The newest and largest terminal at Heathrow Airport, serving mainly international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 3
terminals.description: The second oldest terminal at Heathrow Airport, used for long-haul flights to Asia and the Middle East.

terminals.name: Terminal 4
terminals.description: The second largest terminal at Heathrow Airport, serving mainly long-haul flights to Africa and the Americas.

terminals.name: Terminal 5
terminals.description: The most modern terminal at Heathrow Airport, used exclusively by British Airways and Iberia.

wifi.note: Free for the first 45 minutes, then a fee is required for longer access.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Stansted Airport handles all incoming and outgoing flights for both domestic and international destinations.

terminals.name: Satellite Terminal
terminals.description: The satellite terminal at Stansted Airport is primarily used for low-cost airlines and handles a large volume of passengers.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport. Simply select the network and follow the instructions to connect.
